column1: On [[2 May]] [[1955]], [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] wrote '''[[Letters not published in "The Letters of J.R.R. Tolkien"
column2: a letter]] to Miss Turnbull''' in Whitby, Yorkshire.<ref name=CG>{{CG

column1: *'''Contents:''' Tolkien writes that he is currently "''putting final touches on the [[The Return of the King
column2: third volume]] of'' [[The Lord of the Rings]] ''(evidently in [[The Lord of the Rings Appendices
column5: E]]).''"<ref name=CG/> He remarks that delays in the publication of ''The Return of the King'' have been his fault, not the publishers. Furthermore, Tolkien mentions other writings.<ref name=Dacobra>{{webcite
column8: articlename=THE RETURN OF THE KING - first edition in dj with A.L.S. (sold by Dacobra Books, Tanilba Bay, NSW, Australia)

column1: *'''Description:''' Handwritten letter, signed, Tolkien's Sandfield Road stationery.<ref name=Dacobra/>
*'''Publication:''' The letter was quoted in ''[[Sotheby's English Literature and History 18 July 1991]]''.
